dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/1547651849 at Tue Aug 31 02:35:30 UTC 2021

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: praefect Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

panels.title: praefect Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: praefect Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.title: praefect_cloudsql SLI Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="praefect_cloudsql",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or

    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="praefect_cloudsql",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""

  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="praefect_cloudsql",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""

  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="praefect_cloudsql",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""

  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="praefect_cloudsql",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})),

panels.title: praefect_cloudsql SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Praefect uses a GCP CloudSQL instance. This SLI represents SQL transactions to that service.



### Observability Tools

* [Cloud SQL](https://console.cloud.google.com/sql/instances/praefect-db-9dfb/overview?project=gitlab-production)
* [Stackdriver Logs: Cloud SQL praefect-db-9dfb](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource%2Elabels%2Edatabase%5Fid%3D%22gitlab%2Dproduction%3Apraefect%2Ddb%2D9dfb%22%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Eproject%5Fid%3D%22gitlab%2Dproduction%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22cloudsql%5Fdatabase%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-production)

sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="proxy",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}),

  or

    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="proxy",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})))),

panels.title: proxy SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

All Gitaly operations pass through the Praefect proxy on the way to a Gitaly instance. This SLI monitors
those operations in aggregate.



### Observability Tools

* [Google Stackdriver Continuous Profiling](https://console.cloud.google.com/profiler;timespan=4h/praefect;type=CPU/cpu?project=gitlab-production)
* [üêû Sentry Releases: gitlab/praefect-production](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/praefect-production/releases?environment=${environment})
* [üêû Sentry issues](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/praefect-production/issues?environment=${environment})
* [üìñ Kibana: Praefect logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.hostname,json.virtual_storage,json.grpc.method,json.relative_path,json.grpc.code,json.grpc.time_ms),filters:!((query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:praefect,type:phrase))))),index:'AW98WAQvqthdGjPJ8jTY')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìñ Kibana: Praefect slow request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.hostname,json.virtual_storage,json.grpc.method,json.relative_path,json.grpc.code,json.grpc.time_ms),filters:!((query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:praefect,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.msg:(query:unary,type:phrase)))),(query:(range:(json.grpc.time_ms:(gte:1000))))),index:'AW98WAQvqthdGjPJ8jTY',sort:!(!(json.grpc.time_ms,desc)))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìñ Kibana: Praefect failed request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.hostname,json.virtual_storage,json.grpc.method,json.relative_path,json.grpc.code,json.grpc.time_ms),filters:!((query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:praefect,type:phrase)))),(meta:(negate:!t),query:(match:(json.grpc.code:(query:OK,type:phrase)))),(exists:(field:json.grpc.code))),index:'AW98WAQvqthdGjPJ8jTY')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Praefect requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW98WAQvqthdGjPJ8jTY&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:praefect,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Praefect failed requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW98WAQvqthdGjPJ8jTY&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:praefect,type:phrase)))),(meta:(negate:!t),query:(match:(json.grpc.code:(query:OK,type:phrase)))),(exists:(field:json.grpc.code))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Praefect sum latency aggregated](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW98WAQvqthdGjPJ8jTY&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:praefect,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.grpc.time_ms),schema:metric,type:sum),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.grpc.method.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderBy:'1',otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'Sum+Request+Duration:+json.grpc.time_ms'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Praefect sum latency aggregated (split)](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW98WAQvqthdGjPJ8jTY&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:praefect,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.grpc.time_ms),schema:metric,type:sum),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.grpc.method.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderBy:'1',otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'Sum+Request+Duration:+json.grpc.time_ms'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Praefect percentile latency aggregated](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW98WAQvqthdGjPJ8jTY&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:praefect,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.grpc.time_ms,percents:!(95)),schema:metric,type:percentiles),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'p95+Request+Duration:+json.grpc.time_ms'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Praefect percentile latency aggregated (split)](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW98WAQvqthdGjPJ8jTY&_a=(filters:!((query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:praefect,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.grpc.time_ms,percents:!(95)),schema:metric,type:percentiles),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.grpc.method.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderAgg:(enabled:!t,id:'3-orderAgg',params:(field:json.grpc.time_ms),schema:orderAgg,type:sum),orderBy:custom,otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'p95+Request+Duration:+json.grpc.time_ms'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

panels.title: replicator_queue SLI Apdex

sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="replicator_queue",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="replicator_queue",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="replicator_queue",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""

    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="replicator_queue",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="praefect"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""

  or

panels.title: replicator_queue SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Praefect replication operations. Latency represents the queuing delay before replication is carried out.

panels.description: CPU scheduling waiting on the run queue, as a percentage of time. Aggregated to worst CPU per node. Lower is better.
panels.title: CPU Scheduling Waiting

panels.description: Loadavg (1 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load1{{"env": "$environment", "environment": "$environment", "stage": "$stage", "type": "praefect"}})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", {"env": "$environment", "environment": "$environment", "stage": "$stage", "type": "praefect"}})

panels.title: loadavg1 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (5 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load5{{"env": "$environment", "environment": "$environment", "stage": "$stage", "type": "praefect"}})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", {"env": "$environment", "environment": "$environment", "stage": "$stage", "type": "praefect"}})

panels.title: loadavg5 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (15 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load15{{"env": "$environment", "environment": "$environment", "stage": "$stage", "type": "praefect"}})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", {"env": "$environment", "environment": "$environment", "stage": "$stage", "type": "praefect"}})

panels.title: loadavg15 per core

panels.description:
Cgroup memory utilization per node.

Some services, notably Gitaly, are configured to run within a cgroup with a memory limit lower than the
memory limit for the node. This ensures that a traffic spike to Gitaly does not affect other services on the node.

If this resource is becoming saturated, this may indicate traffic spikes to Gitaly, abuse or possibly resource leaks in
the application. Gitaly or other git processes may be killed by the OOM killer when this resource is saturated.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        container_memory_usage_bytes{id="/system.slice/gitlab-runsvdir.service", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} -
        container_memory_cache{id="/system.slice/gitlab-runsvdir.service", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"} -
        container_memory_swap{id="/system.slice/gitlab-runsvdir.service", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}
      )
      /
      container_spec_memory_limit_bytes{id="/system.slice/gitlab-runsvdir.service", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cgroup_memory component saturation: Cgroup Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Disk inode utilization per device per node.

If this is too high, its possible that a directory is filling up with
files. Consider logging in an checking temp directories for large numbers
of files
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - (
        node_filesystem_files_free{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}
        /
        node_filesystem_files{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_inodes component saturation: Disk inode Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Disk space utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        1 - instance:node_filesystem_avail:ratio{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", fqdn!="", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Space Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Go's memory allocation strategy can make it look like a Go process is saturating memory when measured using RSS, when in fact
the process is not at risk of memory saturation. For this reason, we measure Go processes using the `go_memstat_alloc_bytes`
metric instead of RSS.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
        go_memstats_alloc_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}
      )
      /
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
        node_memory_MemTotal_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: go_memory component saturation: Go Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{fqdn!="", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Netfilter connection tracking table utilization per node.

When saturated, new connection attempts (incoming SYN packets) are dropped with no reply, leaving clients to slowly retry (and typically fail again) over the next several seconds.  When packets are being dropped due to this condition, kernel will log the event as: "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet".
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max_over_time(node_nf_conntrack_entries{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}[1m])
      /
      node_nf_conntrack_entries_limit{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nf_conntrack_entries component saturation: conntrack Entries per Node

panels.description:
Measures the amount of scheduler waiting time that processes are waiting
to be scheduled, according to [`CPU Scheduling Metrics`](https://www.robustperception.io/cpu-scheduling-metrics-from-the-node-exporter).

A high value indicates that a node has more processes to be run than CPU time available
to handle them, and may lead to degraded responsiveness and performance from the application.

Additionally, it may indicate that the fleet is under-provisioned.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without (cpu) (rate(node_schedstat_waiting_seconds_total{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}[1h]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: node_schedstat_waiting component saturation: Node Scheduler Waiting Time

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shard_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Shard

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{fqdn!="", mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="praefect"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Replication queueing latency is the time between scheduling a replication and the start of the execution
of the replication.
panels.title: Replication Queuing Latency

panels.description:
Replication latency is the duration of replication jobs from the start of execution, following after queueing,
until the replication job completes.
panels.title: Replication Latency
